intro: Ononis adenotricha f. biflora, commonly known as the bifloral sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The species is noted for its ecological importance in stabilizing soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
